certificate_of_origin_no: Find the certificate number by labels "Certificate of Origin No", "Certificate No", "Register No", "REG. No" or "REGISTER No". Keep the exact string (letters/digits/symbols) and add to certificate_of_origin_no.
certificate_of_origin_date: Determine the issue date from the certifying authority block ("Place and date, signature and stamp of certifying authority"). If multiple dates exist (e.g., exporter declaration date and certification date), prioritize the certification date. Add to certificate_of_origin_date.
invoice_no: Extract invoice number(s) from the section with explicit invoice reference (e.g., "Number and date of Invoices"). If multiple, join with "; ". Add to invoice_no.
invoice_date: Next to invoice number(s), extract invoice date(s). If multiple, join with "; ". Keep format as in document and add to invoice_date.
country_of_origin: Look for an explicit label "Origin: ...", "Country of origin", or a header indicating origin country (e.g., "Goods produced in ..."). Extract the country and add to country_of_origin.
exporter: Take the full legal exporter name from "Goods consigned from (Exporter’s ...)". Keep the whole line (address in the same line if present) and add to exporter.
importer: Take the full legal importer/consignee name from "Goods consigned to (Consignee’s ...)". Keep the whole line (address in the same line if present) and add to importer.
destination: Determine destination by fields like "Importing country", "To ... (route)" or similar. Prefer "Importing country"; if a delivery city is given, include it with the country. Add to destination.
vessel: Find transport/route info ("Means of transport and route"). Extract vessel name and voyage number if shown as one line. Add to vessel.
container_no: In the marks/packing block, extract container number(s) in format 4 letters + 7 digits (e.g., BMOU9288991). If multiple, join with "; ". Add to container_no.
veterinary_seal: Extract only explicit veterinary/health seal numbers ("Veterinary seal", "Health seal"). Do not confuse with linear seal/Seal No. If none, leave empty. Add to veterinary_seal.
linear_seal: If the certificate lists seal numbers ("Seal No.", "Seal Number") for containers, extract them. If multiple, join with "; ". Add to linear_seal.
HS_code: If "HS CODE"/"Tariff code" is shown, extract code(s) exactly (e.g., 0304.81). If multiple (per product lines), collect unique and join with "; ". Add to HS_code.
products: The "products" block is expandable: create product_1, product_2, ... for each goods line. Keep order. For each position fill all available fields and set token_refs to the source fragments. If some attributes are given in a shared block (e.g., one HS code for all), duplicate them into the relevant product_i.
products[*].name_product: Take the commercial name from the goods description (e.g., "FROZEN ATLANTIC SALMON FILLET"). If multi-line, join into one line. Put Latin species in latin_name. Add to products[i].name_product.
products[*].latin_name: If a Latin species name appears in parentheses (e.g., "SALMO SALAR"), extract it and add to products[i].latin_name. If none, leave empty.
products[*].size_product: If size/grade is shown (e.g., "3-4 LB", "80/120", "1.3-1.8 KG"), extract as one line and add to products[i].size_product. If not, leave empty.
products[*].unit_box: If an accounting/pricing unit is explicitly shown ("per carton", "per kg", "unit"), extract and add to products[i].unit_box. If not shown in CoO, leave empty.
products[*].packages: Extract number of packages by labels "Number and kind of packages", "Cases/Cartons/Packages". Keep number and type if needed (e.g., "1375 CASES") in one line. Add to products[i].packages.
products[*].price_per_unit: If unit price is shown in CoO (rare), extract with currency/format and add to products[i].price_per_unit. If no price, leave empty.
products[*].total_price: If line total is shown in CoO (rare), extract with currency/format and add to products[i].total_price. If no amount, leave empty (do not compute).
products[*].net_weight: Extract net weight per item ("NET KGS", "Net weight", possibly inside description). Keep number and unit as in document. Add to products[i].net_weight.
products[*].gross_weight: Extract gross weight per item from "Gross weight"/"Gross weight or other quantity". Keep number format and unit. Add to products[i].gross_weight.
